text: "Is this some kind of joke? If you are who you say you are, you're on several $faction wanted lists."
"You're already commissioned by $theOtherCommissionFaction. You'll have to resign that commission before you can be commissioned by $theFaction."
"I'm sorry, but you don't meet our criteria for receiving a commission."

"Hmm, yes, you're a suitable candidate.

Accepting a commission is a serious matter. You will be required to fight enemies of $theFaction, wherever they may be found.

You'll be able to resign your commission at any time, though I don't imagine doing so would win you any friends."
"So, how about it? Still want to sign on?"
"Excellent! Welcome to the service."
"Anything else I can do for you?"

"Yes, not everyone has it in them to uphold the values of $theFaction to such a high standard. No shame in it.

Anything else I can do for you?"
"Are you sure? $TheFaction needs people it can rely on, and turning your back like this won't be easily forgotten."
"I can see there's no changing your mind. Well, at least you had the courtesy to tender your resignation in person."
"A good decision. We can use people like you."
"Acknowledging receipt of AIS code. Good to see you, $playerName."
"Hostile $shipOrFleet, be advised: we've already dispatched a distress call to a nearby patrol, and it should arrive shortly."

The enemy $personRank looks grim but defiant. "We will fight you to the last," $heOrShe says.
OR
"Damn, we're in a tight spot." $PersonRank $personName suddenly notices the line is open and shuts it off.
It appears the enemy $personRank doesn't seem to feel the need to talk to you, as your comm requests go unanswered.
"You have been scanned and identified. It's probably best for both our peace of mind if you keep your distance."
